alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 15 at 3:09PM MDT until April 15 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR BOULDER AND THE WESTERN DENVER SUBURBS, AND PALMER DIVIDE AREA...FIRE WEATHER ZONES 239 AND 241... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 239 and 241. * Timing...Until 7 pm this evening. * Winds...Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...around 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fire that develops will have the potential to spread rapidly. Outdoor burning should be avoided, as well as any activity that may produce a spark and start a fast moving wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
